danger_zone

Class DangerNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • danger_zone.DangerNode

  •  class DangerNode
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    2012-10-2 The DangerNode class is a node of a K-d Tree of dimensionality 2. It contains an id for reference to an outside database as well as a timestamp identified with the time the Danger Zone took place or was entered into the database. The Node is sorted by longitude and latitude which are stored in the coordinates array in their respective order.

        public DangerNode(float longitude,
          float latitude,
          int id)
        Creates an instance of the DangerNode.g
        Parameters:
        longitude - The longitude coordinate of the danger zone associated with id
        latitude - The latitude coordinate of the danger zone associated with id
        id - The integer id for the database entry associated with the danger zone

          float latitude,

        Parameters:
        longitude - The longitude coordinate of the danger zone associated with id
        latitude - The latitude coordinate of the danger zone associated with id
        id - The integer id for the database entry associated with the danger zone
        lChild - the left child of the DangerNode
        rChild - the right child of the DangerNode

      • DangerNode

          float latitude,
          int id,
          DangerNode lChild,
          DangerNode rChild,

        longitude - The longitude coordinate of the danger zone associated with id
        latitude - The latitude coordinate of the danger zone associated with id
        id - The integer id for the database entry associated with the danger zone
        lChild - the left child of the DangerNode
        rChild - the right child of the DangerNode
        tStamp - Timestamp in SQL Format

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public DangerNode search(float[] searchTuple)
        Searches the tree for the searchTuple given, returns null if not found and a DangerNode if found. Note this search is note the nearest neighbor search
        Parameters:
        searchTuple - The tuple of floats we're searching for.
        Returns:
        null if not found, the DangerNode if found.

      • innerSearch

        private DangerNode innerSearch(float[] searchTuple,
                     int depth)
        Search used by search function to search along the correct axis given the depth of the tree
        Parameters:
        searchTuple - the tuple of floats we're searching for.
        depth - The depth of the tree, required to compute the proper sorting axis of the tree
        Returns:
        null if not found, the DangerNode if found.

      • getCoordinate

        public float getCoordinate(int index)
        Gets the coordinate at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - Since coordinates are a 2-Tuple, should be either 0 or 1
        Returns:
        The coordinate at that index.

        Parameters:
        newNode - The node to be added.

      • innerAddNode

        public void innerAddNode(DangerNode newNode,
                int depth)
        Private helping function for adding a node, required to sort properly on the depth without exposing to user
        Parameters:
        newNode - the node to be added
        depth - The depth of the current node we're on. Used for sorting by an axis
